content.raw: Wow! it seems like a lot has been going on here, I'll make sure to have a look this weekend :thumbsup:
content.html: Wow! it seems like a lot has been going on here, I'll make sure to have a look this weekend

content.raw: Pull request #150 contains only the changes related to the scene size
content.html: Pull request #150 contains only the changes related to the scene size

content.raw: Fixed conflicts into pull request #149
content.html: Fixed conflicts into pull request #149

content.raw: Okay, I too will have another look, might as well find sth that has to be fixed or could be tested.
content.html: Okay, I too will have another look, might as well find sth that has to be fixed or could be tested.

content.raw: Feel free to pull the fixes here too, I don't mind the order
content.html: Feel free to pull the fixes here too, I don't mind the order

content.raw: I see, so we have to merge #146 first.
content.html: I see, so we have to merge #146 first.

content.raw: I'm also worried that `this.customUrls` is bypassing a lot of the existing logic, so I'm trying to make sure there are no corner cases we forgot about or that we're not accidentally breaking something else.
content.html: I'm also worried that this.customUrls is bypassing a lot of the existing logic, so I'm trying to make sure there are no corner cases we forgot about or that we're not accidentally breaking something else.

I noticed a couple of problems with gzshaders when I was working on pull request #146. We need to remove the // from the strings, and the following 2 lines have errors:

+      options.uniforms.vertexShader = this.heightmapVS;
+      options.uniforms.fragmentShader = this.heightmapFS;

content.raw: So is this PR still waiting anything? @chapulina
content.html: So is this PR still waiting anything? @chapulina

content.raw: Refactored the gzshaders part of the code a bit on pull request #146
content.html: Refactored the gzshaders part of the code a bit on pull request #146

update.description:
* disable control outside canvas

* using relative positions of mouse events to the canvas

* reusable gzweb

update.title: Reusable gzweb.

content.raw: Okay will check for that (y)
content.html: Okay will check for that (y)

content.raw: We should catch the case when no model file is found in the customUrls
content.html: We should catch the case when no model file is found in the customUrls

content.raw: It would probably be safe to look for `.sdf`
content.html: It would probably be safe to look for .sdf

content.raw: We should avoid hardcoding `model.sdf` because Gazebo allows this file to have any name. The name is determined on `model.config`.
content.html: We should avoid hardcoding model.sdf because Gazebo allows this file to have any name. The name is determined on model.config.

content.raw: I suppose if the URI is malformed `textureUri` would never be set, but I think the consequence of leaving `texture` undefined is not bad
content.html: I suppose if the URI is malformed textureUri would never be set, but I think the consequence of leaving texture undefined is not bad

content.raw: In the other occurrences like the `textureUri`, it must have found a `textureUri` to have reached this point @lines 380s .
content.html: In the other occurrences like the textureUri, it must have found a textureUri to have reached this point @lines 380s .

content.raw: Ahh got it! Let's keep it then, thanks!
content.html: Ahh got it! Let's keep it then, thanks!

content.raw: Right, right now yes it is not used, but if we were to use the File API it will be
content.html: Right, right now yes it is not used, but if we were to use the File API it will be

content.raw: Yeah I saw that, but this function is not used by the sdf viewer, right? See the example html below
content.html: Yeah I saw that, but this function is not used by the sdf viewer, right? See the example html below

content.raw:
Well right now in `gzscene` we use the `sdfparser` in the `modelspawner`

```js
  var sdfXml = this.spawnModel.sdfParser.parseXML(sdf);
```
content.html:
Well right now in gzscene we use the sdfparser in the modelspawner

  var sdfXml = this.spawnModel.sdfParser.parseXML(sdf);

content.raw:
We can also remove:

* `gzmanipulator` since the models being viewed can't be translated / rotated
* `gzlogplay`
* `gzradialmenu` to be consistent: menus for desktop are not included, so neither should be those for mobile
* `gzspawnmodel`, it looks like we don't need it for this use case?

If we can really get rid of all of those, we would actually end up with only `gz`, `gzscene` and `gzssdfparser`, so we might as well add them one by one.
content.html:
We can also remove:

  • gzmanipulator since the models being viewed can't be translated / rotated
  • gzlogplay
  • gzradialmenu to be consistent: menus for desktop are not included, so neither should be those for mobile
  • gzspawnmodel, it looks like we don't need it for this use case?

If we can really get rid of all of those, we would actually end up with only gz, gzscene and gzssdfparser, so we might as well add them one by one.

content.raw:
Yeah that would be cool.

I will merge in default and make sure it works as soon as I get to my
computer :thumpsup:
content.html:
Yeah that would be cool.

I will merge in default and make sure it works as soon as I get to my computer :thumpsup:

content.html: Now that pull request #138 has been merged, it would be nice to make sure STLs also work with the SDF viewer

content.raw: I think it would be safer to do it everywhere, but here we should return after the error, there it should be ok to continue
content.html: I think it would be safer to do it everywhere, but here we should return after the error, there it should be ok to continue

content.raw: Done :wink:
content.html: Done

content.html: Thanks for noticing that, I've also moved the computation of the getBoundingClientRect to the getRayCastModel, no need for the canvasX or anything.

content.html: We should make sure it is not being triggered twice

content.html: Maybe we can try debugging this to make sure.

content.raw: I guess the `document` event listener alone would do.
content.html: I guess the document event listener alone would do.

content.raw: I believe we don't have to do the same in the other places, like `createMaterial` , right?
content.html: I believe we don't have to do the same in the other places, like createMaterial , right?
